message: What do you mean by this?  I'm sorry, I just don't quite understand.
I know it is a matter of personal taste, just wanted to let you know
So I understand why it's in but wish it didn't squick me out like it does. Meh.
A -1 on scroll the whole page from me.
I guess he means that when you're in a topic, the message list scrolls while moving the mousewheel, but the header and the boxes on the left stay there fixed.

The scrollbar-only-scrolls-the-comments-box behavior is great aesthetically, but from a UX standpoint I don't like it; it breaks my expectations of what the browser's scrollbar is going to do and makes me feel funny.

-1 I think it works. if the whole page scrolled topics and pages would get so annoying when they get long. I like the forward chron here it feels like a good old fashioned chat room, keeping menu and chat box stationary is better UX.
-1. I really like the current implementation :-)
The scrolling UI itself is not annoying. It's the visual lag that's annoying. I'm using the latest Chrome 9.x on Mac 10.6.6.
Its a little annoying. On my MBP yesterday, I had to fullscreen the browser so I could see the bottom of the recent topics list.
@bitprophet  I agree, if the scroll bar was in the chat window, then it would make more sense. In a world of scroll wheels, though..
-1 really like the current implementation and execution
-1 also... I don't notice any lag on Chrome 9.x on Mac 10.6.6
